page.title: 12The Walton Gala
page.content: The north east of our area contains a part of the village of Walton. Like many of the villages in the area it has been surrounded by expensive houses and yet has managed to maintain many of its traditions. One such tradition is the Annual Walton Gala. We sent along some of our form to report on this popular local event. Like most village galas it started with a procession through the village. The custom is for the Gala Queen to lead the procession through the village on a horse drawn carriage. This year Julie Scollan who is in the first year at our school was Gala Queen. Apart from the usual stalls there was a majorette display, a raft race and a "Brain of Walton Competition.All proceeds from this enjoyable event will go to the Walton Community Centre
